description: Borrowed from New Latin agminātus, from the Classical Latin agmen (“a troop”, oblique stem: agmin-) +‎ -ātus (“-ate”). Compare the Latin agminātim (“in hosts”, “in hordes”, adverb).

adjectives.description: agminate (comparative more agminate, superlative most agminate)

examples: the agminated glands of Peyer in the small intestine
